intro: Carex hians, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, three-sided spikelets that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in moist to wet environments, such as marshes and stream banks. Carex hians is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic ecosystems.
